author: PR Newswire (Canada)
title: Introducing Four Additions to Crowe Soberman's Partner Lineup
text:
TORONTO , Jan. 1, 2024 /CNW/ - Crowe Soberman LLP is proud to welcome Adam Gur, Adam Leibel , Alice Madolciu and Adrianne Markell to the firm's partnership.
"I am delighted to announce four individuals who have reached the significant milestone of being named partner at Crowe Soberman effective this year. What adds an additional element of excitement to this group is that each of the four has dedicated substantial portions of their careers right here, with two of them having exclusively been part of the Crowe family, demonstrating their commitment to our firm" says Managing Partner Adam Scherer .
Adam Gur, BBA, CPA, CA
Adam started at the firm in 2015 becoming a CPA in 2016. He provides advisory services to his clients through tax, financial planning, and assurance services by overseeing audit and review engagements. Adam is deeply committed to his craft and possesses extensive experience, particularly in owner-managed businesses within real estate, construction, professional services, and retail industries. Adam collaborates with his clients and their advisors to ensure all parties are up to date with evolving legislation to ensure sustained business success.
Adam Leibel , CPA, CA
Adam joined Crowe Soberman in 2012 and earned his CPA designation in 2015. In his role, he manages audit, review, and compilation projects while also handling personal and corporate tax planning. Combining his expertise with a love for training, Adam conducts courses for both junior and senior staff, covering topics such as personal taxes and accounting for marketable securities. Adam thrives on the rewarding feeling of providing small business owners/managers with advice that positively influences the growth of their businesses.
Alice Madolciu, CPA, CA
Alice has carved out a niche for herself in the cross-border entertainment space, routinely helping clients navigate complicated cross-border issues. She offers tax planning services and handles personal and corporate tax compliance for a wide range of global clients. Her expertise extends to businesses operating in Canada , spanning diverse backgrounds and industry sectors. Alice helps guide the firm's Sports and Entertainment Group, providing tax services to musicians, actors and entertainers, behind-the scenes personnel, including touring crews, film directors and producers, foreign corporations operating in Canada , and individuals immigrating to and emigrating from Canada .
Adrianne Markell , CPA, CA, CBV, AM, CEIV
Adrianne joined the firm in 2015 and is part of the firm's Valuations | Forensics | Litigation (VFL) team at Crowe Soberman. She has a background in business valuations, shareholder disputes, and economic damage quantification, with experience in auditing and tax. Adrianne specializes in the preparation of expert reports for the quantification of personal and commercial loss claims as well as litigation support. She conducts business valuations for a wide array of engagements, including financial reporting, oppression remedies, and transactions. She has a unique set of skills with knowledge in insurance claims, estate litigation and dependency claim matters.
About Crowe Soberman LLP
Celebrating over 60 years in the Toronto community, our 40 partners and over 200 team members make Crowe Soberman one of the leading accounting & advisory firms in Canada . We are Chartered Professional Accountants, tax professionals and financial consultants to high-net-worth individuals, not-for-profit organizations, and entrepreneurial companies. We focus on healthcare; construction & real estate; manufacturing & distribution; sports, entertainment & media; professionals; information technology and retail industries. Our services include Audit & Advisory, Business Diagnostics Solutions, Corporate Recovery & Turnaround, Due Diligence, Estates & Trusts, HR Consulting, Indirect Tax, International Tax, Management Services, Mergers & Acquisitions, Personal Insolvency, Sports & Entertainment, Succession Planning, SuRE Services for Family Business (Succession, Retirement, and Estate Planning), Tax and Valuations | Forensics | Litigation.
About Crowe Global
Crowe Global is ranked among the top 10 global accounting networks with more than 200 independent accounting and advisory services firms in more than 130 countries around the world. Crowe Global member firms are committed to impeccable quality service, highly integrated service delivery processes and a common set of core values that guide decisions daily. Each firm is well-established as a leader in its national business community and is staffed by nationals, thereby providing a knowledge of local laws and customs which is important to clients undertaking new ventures or expanding into other countries. Crowe Global member firms are known for their personal service to privately- and publicly held businesses in all sectors and have built an international reputation in the areas of audit, tax, and advisory services.
SOURCE Crowe Soberman LLP

author: Jasmin Farah
title: 5 Fehler von Katzenhaltern, die Samtpfoten nicht leiden können
text:
5 Fehler von Katzenhaltern, die Samtpfoten nicht leiden können
Katzen sind empfindsame Tiere – und sehr eigenwillig. Es kann daher sein, dass Besitzer Dinge tun, die sie nicht leiden können – und merken es nicht einmal. Eine Expertin gibt Tipps.
Haustierbesitzer wollen nur das Beste für ihre Tiere. Des Deutschen liebster Fellfreund ist die Katze. Doch während sie weithin als pflegeleicht gilt, raten Katzenexperten eindringlich, die Samtpfoten nicht zu unterschätzen. Zwar sind die Tiere sehr unabhängig und eigenwillig, dennoch gibt es einiges bei der Pflege zu beachten. Hinzu kommt, dass Katzen gewisse Vorlieben haben und vom Charakter her Gewohnheitstiere sind. Mit der Folge, dass Halter unbewusst Dinge tun oder ein Verhalten an den Tag legen, die ihre Stubentiger unnötig stressen können.
Was Katzen gar nicht mögen, aber Halter ständig tun – laut Expertin
Das weiß auch Katzenexpertin Amanda Campion, die auf TikTok unter ihrem Account @kittysittycatbehaviour viele Tipps gibt, um die Bindung von Halter und Tier zu stärken. In einem Video klärt die Britin über fünf häufige Fehler von Haltern auf, die Katzen nicht ausstehen können. Oftmals geschehe dies allerdings unbewusst, so Campion.
1. Katzenklo steht zu nah an Futter
Manche Halter denken, es sei praktischer für den Stubentiger, das Katzenklo in der Nähe seines Futternapfes zu stellen. Doch das sei ein Irrtum, klärt die TikTokerin auf. Viel lieber mögen es Katzen, wenn ihre Toilette etwas abseits steht, wo es ruhig ist und sie sich zurückziehen können.
2. Katzenfutter draußen stehen lassen
Ein weiterer Fehler sei, das Katzenfutter ständig draußen stehen bzw. im Napf liegenzulassen. Der Gedanke dahinter sei verlockend, gibt Campion im Video zu. Wenn man den ganzen Tag auf der Arbeit ist oder es mit der Katze einfach nur gut meint, sei das verständlich, erklärt die Katzenexpertin weiter. Doch die Folgen können verheerend sein: Es drohen nicht nur Langeweile auf Seiten der Katze, sondern auch Gewichtsprobleme. Die Katze wird zu dick, da ihr Sättigungsgefühl nicht immer zuverlässig ist.
Noch mehr spannende Tier-Themen finden Sie in unserem kostenlosen Partner-Newsletter von Landtiere.de, den Sie gleich hier abonnieren können.
3. Kein Kratzbaum
Es liegt in der Natur der Katze, dass sie kratzen will, weiß Campion. Sie tun es, um die eigenen Krallen zu schärfen sowie um zu markieren. Auch wenn man diese regelmäßig kürze, hätten die Samtpfoten noch das Bedürfnis zu kratzen, weil es sich gut anfühle, erklärt sie weiter. Es schütte Glückshormone wie Endorphine aus und es helfe ihnen zu entspannen. Demnach sei ein Kratzbaum ein Muss, folgert die Katzenexpertin.
4. Bestrafung mit Wasserflasche & Co.
Macht die Katze etwas, was sie nicht darf, greifen manche Halter zu zweifelhaften Bestrafungsmethoden. Ganz vorne liegt die Wasserflasche, mit der sie die Katze besprühen – wohl wissentlich, dass viele Samtpfoten Wasser scheuen. Das funktioniert nicht, klärt Campion auf. Darunter leide nur die Beziehung zum Stubentiger. Es zerstöre das Vertrauensverhältnis und ändere nichts am Verhalten der Katze, so die Britin. Stattdessen sollte man die Katze besser loben, wenn sie etwas von sich aus richtig tut, etwa, wenn sie selbstständig von der Küchenzeile hinunterspringt.
5. Zu wenig Ressourcen
Wer mehr als eine Katze hat, sollte auch daran denken, dass er mehr Futter, Spielzeug oder Schlaf- und Rückzugsorte für die pelzigen Freunde benötigt. Ansonsten kann es sein, dass die Tiere konkurrieren und sich streiten. Um Spannungen abzubauen oder dem gar vorzubeugen, müssen ihnen also immer genug Mittel zur Verfügung stehen, schließt der Profi.

author: @americanfamassc
title: AFA.net - Gillette INTIMATE Ad Is Extremely Inappropriate!
text: [MORE](/the-stand/authors/monica-cole/) Gillette INTIMATE needs to be held accountable for the disgusting commercial that repeatedly hints about and focuses on shaving men’s genitalia. This specific commercial, “Respect Your Junk,” with its tagline, “Respect Your Pubic Region,” is currently airing on television and appears to be gaining even more air time recently (in correlation to the sudden increase of complaints 1MM has received regarding this advertisement). The ad begins with a man standing in front of his bathroom mirror wearing a towel around his waist, as he peaks down inside to evaluate the need for grooming. During this commercial, the man is shown in his shower no longer wearing his towel or shaving below his belly button, while his hand continues down towards his groin. But the camera shot cuts off to the right before his pubic region is visible to the audience. The script states: “Guys, it’s time to stop treating your groins like junk! Introducing the new ‘INTIMATE’ pubic hair trimmer from Gillette. It’s not junk, so treat it right with a gentle and easy shave from America’s #1 trusted men’s grooming brand. Respect your pubic region with Gillette INTIMATE.” At the end of the advertisement, the man begins to dress and zips up his pants since he is finished grooming down there. This commercial is entirely too specific and graphic for television. The details are over the top. Yet, Gillette still chose to air this commercial despite its obviously controversial nature. It has been brought to our attention that the ad has aired on a children’s network as well. Can you imagine what goes through a child’s mind when viewing this ad? 1MM has received many complaints from parents. Gillette should be ashamed! Gillette needs to know that conservative parents disapprove of its advertising tactics. The company may push away customers if it continues advertising in a repulsive manner that offends parents. [Please sign our petition](https://onemillionmoms.com/current-campaigns/gillette-intimate-ad-is-extremely-inappropriate/) urging Gillette INTIMATE to cancel this inappropriate commercial immediately!

author: @Kent_Online
title: British medic who died in Ukraine ‘devoted her life to helping others’
text: More on KentOnline A British woman who died as a combat medic in Ukraine “devoted her life to helping others”, her family said. Katherine Mielniczuk went to Ukraine after Russia’s full-scale invasion in 2022, compelled to use her medical skills to help those in need. The 26-year-old, who graduated in chemistry at the University of Bristol, spent almost two years risking her life to provide medical supplies and emergency care to injured Ukrainian and foreign fighters, travelling to the most volatile stretches of the frontline and earning herself the nickname “Apache”. She died in the early hours of Christmas Eve in eastern Ukraine, her family said on Friday. Her death is not being treated as suspicious, they said. Ms Mielniczuk was an “inspiration in resilience and grace” and the “kindest and most selfless person one could hope to meet”, her family said. An online fundraiser has so far garnered almost £3,000 of £10,000 to repatriate Ms Mielniczuk, also known as Kasia, to the UK. Her family said: “It is impossible to truly convey what an incredible woman Katherine was or how deeply and widely she was loved and will be missed. “Kasia is gone, but the endless warmth, love and grace she brought to the world will never be lost”. In a Facebook post on December 23, a day before her death, Ms Mielniczuk asked her followers to keep Ukrainian volunteers in their thoughts, writing that “many of us cannot return home or celebrate Christmas”. She wrote: “The mental, physical, financial consequences of war are catastrophic and a kind word can hold tremendous power for us when we are losing hope and seeing tragedies daily. “We prioritise fighting for a free Ukraine, for a prosperous and fruitful future for Ukrainian children.” A spokesperson for the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office said: “We are supporting the family of a British woman who died in Ukraine and are in touch with the local authorities.” To support repatriation and funeral costs for Ms Mielniczuk, visit: [https://donorbox.org/katherine-mielniczuk](https://donorbox.org/katherine-mielniczuk)

title: 上证50增强ETF易方达（563090）跌0.67%，半日成交额12.89万元|上证50_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，上证50增强ETF易方达（563090）跌0.67%，报1.043元，成交额12.89万元。上证50增强ETF易方达（563090）重仓股方面， 贵州茅台 截止午盘涨0.00%， 海尔智家 跌0.80%， 中国石油 跌1.09%， 招商银行 跌0.70%， 古井贡酒 涨0.46%， 中国平安 跌0.93%， 紫金矿业 跌1.44%， 中国联通 跌1.32%， 药明康德 跌1.02%， 中国太保 跌1.66%。
上证50增强ETF易方达（563090）业绩比较基准为 上证50指数 收益率，管理人为易方达基金管理有限公司，基金经理为张胜记，成立（2024-05-27）以来回报为5.15%，近一个月回报为0.77%。

author: @Region8News
title: Judd Hill Foundation partners with UAMS to provide better care for cancer patients
text: Judd Hill Foundation partners with UAMS to provide better care for cancer patients JONESBORO, Ark. (KAIT) - The Judd Hill Foundation has joined hands with UAMS Northeast Regional Campus to improve the healthcare services for cancer patients in the region. Today, the mayor and many other important personalities gathered at the UAMS Family Medical Center to celebrate this new partnership. As part of this partnership, [the foundation has pledged $1 million](https://www.kait8.com/2024/04/11/foundation-pledges-1-million-nea-cancer-care/) to establish the Judd Hill Foundation Fund for Excellence at the UAMS Northeast East Campus. The chancellor at the University of Arkansas has mentioned that this fund will create a better relationship between healthcare for cancer patients and the people of Northeast Arkansas. “This means a better partnership with the people of Northeast Arkansas this means a connection between UAMS and our partners St Benard’s & Nea Baptist it means an opportunity to better serve and save Arkansas,” said Cam Patterson, chancellor at the University of Arkansas. This partnership will bring healthcare for cancer patients closer to home, so they will not have to travel to Little Rock. “What I’m really grateful for though it brings research right here to Northeast Arkansas, so where the residents of Jonesboro and the surrounding communities don’t have to go for further treatment they can stay right here in Jonesboro,” said Jonesboro Mayor Harold Copenhaver. The fund will also be used to provide cancer patients with more support and connect them with resources and local healthcare providers. To report a typo or correction, please [click here](https://www.kait8.com/page/tips/). Copyright 2024 KAIT. All rights reserved.
